symptoms.name: Burning sensation
symptoms.pattern: Constant, involving both legs, present for 15 months

symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: Aggravated by walking on rough surfaces and cold air

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Evening rise, present for six months

symptoms.name: Painless lump
symptoms.pattern: In left breast, present for one month

symptoms.name: Firm, non-tender, mobile lump
symptoms.pattern: In infero-lateral quadrant of left breast

symptoms.name: Progressive nodular swellings
symptoms.pattern: Over right wrist joint, accompanied by mild pain for a year

symptoms.name: Thickened superficial branch of right radial nerve
symptoms.pattern: Compared to contralateral side, no sensory loss

physical_findings: Hyperaesthesia and allodynia over the soles of her feet
Diminished breath sounds over the right lung base with dullness on percussion
Firm, non-tender and mobile lump in the infero-lateral quadrant of the left breast
Three non-compressible, ill-defined swellings around the right wrist
Thickened superficial branch of the right radial nerve
risk_factors: High prevalence of tuberculosis in developing countries

imaging_findings.thoracic_radiography: Inhomogeneous fluffy shadows in the left mid- and lower zones and the right lower zone, with multiple cavities
imaging_findings.Ultrasound of breast mass: Retro-mammary collection with internal echoes, extending from an erosion in the left fifth rib
imaging_findings.MRI of right wrist: Tenosynovitis of the extensor pollicis brevis and abductor pollicis longus tendons
imaging_findings.High-resolution ultrasound of right wris: Three hypoechoic lesions, thickening of the superficial branch of the radial nerve

required: Positive acid-fast bacilli (AFB) test from sputum or aspirate
Clinical presentation consistent with tuberculous neuritis (e.g., peripheral neuropathy, systemic symptoms)
supportive: Nerve conduction studies showing sensory neuropathy
Nerve biopsy suggestive of chronic axonopathy
Imaging findings consistent with tuberculosis (e.g., pulmonary infiltrates, lymphadenopathy)
